ence base of programmes. WHO is pleased to note that there is now full alignment in the 
nutrition community on programme priorities.
Broad agreement on “what to do” has been one of the factors of the success of the Scaling-up 
Nutrition movement, that has generated unprecedented broader commitment of governments, 
donors and development actors to improve nutrition, towards the achievement, in 2025, of the 
global nutrition targets established by the World Health Assembly. 
Oleg Chestnov
Assista
